timeline.bodyText: discussion on the very very similar #1094 says this needs to go inside the try block because security managers can make this illegal.
timeline.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: same. move into the try block
timeline.author: jkwatson

timeline.message: Move setDaemon calls inside try blocks as they can throw a security exception.

timeline.bodyText: since there is a (admittedly rare) security manager-induced failure mode here, can we add a comment to the javadoc for this class about it?
timeline.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: Note that if we do this here, then newThread will throw if setDaemon fails.
replies.author: Oberon00

replies.bodyText: do we know how fast this fails? I think the javadoc addition should be good to document this fact. Might be good to have a custom threadfactory which will allow non-daemon access if it's forbidden. @johnbley any idea how difficult that would be?
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText:
Probably a better solution:
Implement our own ThreadFactory see what we did in OpenCensus https://github.com/census-instrumentation/opencensus-java/blob/master/impl_core/src/main/java/io/opencensus/implcore/internal/DaemonThreadFactory.java
And always use that to produce threads :)
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: Definitely strong agree on this one!
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.message: Add javadoc comment about possibility of SecurityException.
Create common/DaemonThreadFactory and adjust all thread creation to use it.

timeline.bodyText:
Can we enhance this a bit and accept a thread name prefix + a local atomic integer and name the thread prefix + "_" + atomicval++?
That way we encapsulate everything in this class. What do you think?
